page.title: 19Fen Bridge, Dedham
page.content:
A Bridge Too Far For The R.A.F.
On the 15th February 1985 a large lorry pulled up near our school with two Police escorts. Then we heard a loud chugging sound. We all rushed outside and saw an R.A.F. Chinook helicopter. The helicopter was to lift an 80ft beam into place at Fen Bridge which was used by John Constable on his way from East Bergholt to Dedham Grammar School. The 80ft beam, weighing 12 tons, had come from Holland to Harwich on a cargo ship. The R.A.F. tried four times to put the beam in place but it was impossible because of the draught from the rotors of the helicopter. Now we are waiting for them to bring a crane to do the job.
